intro: Pseudogalium paradoxum subsp. duthiei, commonly known as the Duthie's false bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and taxonomic research.
